page.title: 06ROAD HAULAGE AT ESKDALEMUIR
page.content: With the coming of motorised transport the old custom of driving cattle and sheep to market on foot died out.Eventually in Eskdalemuir this resulted in the establishment ,on one of the centrally situated farms, of a small haulage and contrcting business. Managed by members of the family assisted by fellow workers whose homes are it the valley. This firm provides a variety of services. Lorries, with floats or containers ,transport sheep and cttle to the vrios markets.Sheep are sometimes taken to "winter" on lower ground elsewhere. Fertilisers and foodstuffs are carried gravel is excavated from the river bed for use at building sites and reservoir stations.Roads for farming or forestry are cut out of the hillside and firmed with quarried road-metal.
